result.execSummary:
The defendant George A Helmick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $150 drug testing fee 

The Court indicates that the $100 Cash Bail will be applied toward payment of costs.  

As to the payment of the court financial obligations in both cases, the Court allows an installment-payment plan of $25 per month installments commencing on  6/1/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 37 day jail term [20 days on Case #15CM486, 17 days on Case #16CM141] with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges and release for child-care

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court requires Mr. Helmick to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for DNA sample provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Reminder Notice--Final Notice
Court's Response to non party request received 6-3-2016
from non-party requesting turn in date be extended 5 days
Criminal Case Settlement
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
[MK] cases #15CM486 and #16CM141 called at 9:39am. 
Defendant George A Helmick in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Case #15CM486-Count #1 and on Case #16CM141-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #2 of Case #15CM486 and Counts #2 & #3 of Case #16CM141.
The Defendant rejects Probation.

On Case #15CM486-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Helmick to:
--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges and release for child-care; to commence on June 20th, 2016 [at 6:00pm]
--1 day credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $150 drug testing fee 
The Court requires Mr. Helmick to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for DNA sample provision. 
The Court indicates that the $100 Cash Bail will be applied toward payment of costs.  


On Case #16CM141-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Helmick to:
--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges and release for child-care; to commence on June 20th, 2016 [at 6:00pm], concurrent to case #15CM486
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443
The Court requires Mr. Helmick to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for DNA sample provision. 


As to the payment of the court financial obligations in both cases, the Court allows an installment-payment plan of $25 per month installments commencing on  6/1/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 37 day jail term [20 days on Case #15CM486, 17 days on Case #16CM141] with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess 9:53am.
The Court hereby orders that Case # 16CM141 may be heard in Branch 4, on 5/13/16 for the purposes of Plea and Sentencing.
re: Sentencing

Case called at 1:54pm [mo]
Defendant George A Helmick appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Atty. Hagemann provides an updated address

The Court requires a $100 CASH bond, with conditions:
--not possess or consume any illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 2:01  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  2/17/16 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 3/11/16 at 2:30pm
